meanings.definition: The state or position of being a follower.
meanings.sent1: In the classroom, students learn about followerships by listening to their teacher.
meanings.sent2: Her followerships of the team captain were evident in how she always supported his decisions.
meanings.sent3: The followerships of the puppy to its owner was adorable to watch.
meanings.sent4: The followerships of the stars to the moon in the night sky is a beautiful sight.
meanings.sent5: The followerships of the ducklings waddling behind their mother left a lasting impression on the children.

meanings.definition: The act of following or obeying a leader.
meanings.sent1: During the hike, the group's followerships of the guide ensured they stayed on the right path.
meanings.sent2: His followerships of the rules made him a reliable team player.
meanings.sent3: The followerships of the sheep to the shepherd sometimes led to comical situations.
meanings.sent4: The followerships of the ants in a line marching towards food is a fascinating sight.
meanings.sent5: The followerships of the dancers to the choreographer's instructions created a beautiful performance.

meanings.definition: The collective group of individuals who follow a leader.
meanings.sent1: The followerships of the fans cheered loudly for their favorite singer.
meanings.sent2: The political leader's followerships included people from all walks of life.
meanings.sent3: The followerships of the birds flying in a V formation was a sight to behold.
meanings.sent4: The followerships of the fish swimming together created a mesmerizing display.
meanings.sent5: The followerships of the students towards their mentor was heartwarming to witness.
